basics.name: Yifan Kang
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: A student at MIT studying Mathematics and Computer Science, interested in machine learning, computer vision, and robotics

work.name: MIT
work.summary: Working under Prof. Leslie Pack Kaelbling on few-shot concept discovery and robotic manipulation using diffusion policies with vision-language conditioning.
highlights: Developed few-shot concept discovery framework, implementing diffusion policy with vision-language conditioning for robotic manipulation.

Built comprehensive computer vision pipeline integrating ResNet18 encoders, text embedding networks, and classifier-free guidance for diffusion policy, achieving robust policy adaptation from minimal demonstrations.

Engineered benchmarking system with custom dataset loaders, advanced optimization techniques (AdamW, EMA), and Weights & Biases tracking, evaluating generalization across 12 distinct object-language configurations.

work.name: MIT
work.summary: Working under Prof. Antonio Torralba on visual generation with multimodal LLMs.
highlights: Co-first author of Doodle Agent: Exploring Freeform Visual Generation with Multimodal LLMs (Accepted to ICCV 2025 AI4VA Workshop), a drawing agent for open-ended visual creation using LLMs and structured prompting.

work.name: Research Science Institute (RSI)
work.summary: Authored research paper on quantum circuit synthesis under mentorship of Henry Ma (MIT).
highlights: Authored the paper "CNOT-Optimal Circuit Synthesis" under the mentorship of Henry Ma (MIT); Selected as the top 5 paper at RSI out of 100 candidates.

work.name: MIT PRIMES
work.summary: Conducted research on NUMA-aware data structures and benchmarking, and studied advanced mathematical topics.
highlights: Conducted research on NUMA-aware data structures and benchmarking under Shangdi Yu and Prof. Julian Shun.
Studied advanced mathematical topics including coding theory, game theory, topology, and representation theory.
Presented research findings at the annual MIT PRIMES mini-conference.

work.name: Tencent
work.summary: Selected for Tencent's T-Spark program, a highly competitive research initiative for high school students.
highlights: Selected for Tencent's T-Spark program, a highly competitive research initiative for high school students.
Optimized machine learning models for video recommendation systems, focusing on improving personalization accuracy.

work.name: Yau International Mathcamp
work.summary: Completed advanced coursework in mathematics and presented research findings.
highlights: Completed advanced coursework in linear algebra, algebraic combinatorics, analysis, and topology.
Selected to present a final project proving Kirchhoff's Matrix-Tree Theorem.
